item.title: Sarah Mullally Is Named as First Female Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: Sarah Mullally, the bishop of London, will lead the Church of England. She has been a vocal supporter of the rights of women in the church.

item.title: What to Know About Japan’s Leadership Election
item.description: Japan’s beleaguered governing party will convene for a crucial election that could pave the way for the first female prime minister or the youngest le...

item.title: 2 Victims Named After Manchester Synagogue Terrorist Attack
item.description: The police said Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66, were killed Thursday outside the Heaton Park Congregation synagogue in northwestern England...

item.title: Manchester Synagogue Attack Fuels Fears of Antisemitism in Britain
item.description: In the hours after an attack, a blanket of fear and grief fell over synagogues and Jewish community centers across the country.

item.title: ‘Czech Trump’ Andrej Babis Is Poised to Return as Prime Minister in Elections
item.description: The party of Andrej Babis, former leader of the Czech government, is expected to prevail in parliamentary elections that begin Friday.
